snippet.title: What's behind the display of embalmed world leaders?
snippet.description:
* The body of Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez will rest in a glass case on public display. Forever.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/03/08/world/americas/venezuela-chavez-embalming/index.html

snippet.title: North Korea: A prism to Soviet era
snippet.description:
* I thought I was prepared for North Korea. After all, I'd spent more than half my life studying, traveling to and living in the former Soviet Union as well as other Communist and post-Communist countries.
http://www.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/asiapcf/06/19/nkorea.dougherty.notebook/index.html

snippet.title: North Korea: A prism to Soviet era

snippet.title: 12 restaurants with spectacular views
snippet.description:
* Savings-minded travelers may not always be able to spring for the loftiest hillside hotels, but a single meal at a spectacularly situated restaurant can be a worthy splurge.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/10/19/travel/restaurant-views/index.html

snippet.title: Ballet, jewels and Red Square: A cultural guide to Moscow
snippet.description:
* Whether seen through a flurry of snow, or against a bright blue summer sky, Moscow's architectural landscape is awe-inspiring.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/europe/08/29/guide.heritage.moscow/index.html

snippet.title: Asiaweek
snippet.description:
* Round and round the card turns, spun by an unseen breeze, offering its contrasting views the brash military strategist, face bright with optimism; the aging, slightly rotund Mao, eyes sharp and hard, searching for heresy. Two Maos, but Ma speaks as if they were one. I cant pin down why it is I worship Chairman Mao so much, he says. But if the Chair...
http://www.cnn.com/ASIANOW/asiaweek/96/0906/cs1.html
